benchmark_details.name: SVBench (Streaming Video Understanding Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: SVBench is a pioneering benchmark with temporal multi-turn question-answering chains specifically designed to thoroughly assess the capabilities of streaming video understanding of current Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs). It features 49,979 question-answer pairs across 1,353 streaming videos, evaluating models on long-context scenarios and temporal reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive and in-depth analysis of current LVLMs' capabilities in streaming video understanding.

data.source: Derived from diverse publicly available datasets, including YT-Temporal-1B, YouCook2, ActivityNet, MovieChat, Panda-70M, and Ego4D.
data.format: Varied formats dependent on video content
data.annotation: Semi-automated annotation pipeline utilizing LLMs and professional annotators for quality assurance.

methodology.calculation: Aggregate scores based on predefined criteria for evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Scores indicate reliability and performance of LVLMs in understanding streaming video content.
methodology.validation: Extensive evaluations were conducted with various LVLMs across dialogue and streaming settings.
